channel.title: [Solved] Which Port for Bitmessage / Bitmessage slow down
channel.description:
Hello.
Which Port should i use for Bitmessage? https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation says nothing about Bitmessage. At the moment i use the port 9101 (xchat) because i dont use xchat. But if Bitmessage runs my entire TOR communication is extremly slow. clearnet website takes ~120 sec to load, but only sometimes, mostly they not load. onion sites never load if Bitmessage runs. If i turn off Bitmessage TOR respond normal. The System Monitor display me 2-5 KiB/s receiving, i dont understand why Bitmessage slow down so extremly. Has another person the same issue with bitmessage?

item.title: [Solved] Which Port for Bitmessage / Bitmessage slow down
item.dc:creator: dontknow
item.description:
I have changed the port to 9152 as you suggested and now everything works fine.

Thank you!

Read full topic
item.source: [Solved] Which Port for Bitmessage / Bitmessage slow down

item.title: [Solved] Which Port for Bitmessage / Bitmessage slow down
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I can only answer the stream isolation part.

See:

Whonix – 7 May 20

Stream Isolation

Prevent Identity Correlation through Circuit Sharing by using Tor Stream Isolation

Use one of the prepared custom ports. (Read around “Without IsolateDestAddr and without IsolateDestPort: SocksPort 192.168.0.10:9152 to 9159”.)

No idea about the other part.

Read full topic
item.source: [Solved] Which Port for Bitmessage / Bitmessage slow down

clearnet website takes ~120 sec to load, but only sometimes, mostly they not load.
